events.name: <Cancelled> Learn the dos and don’ts of Mobile UX
events.description: What are the important fundamentals of designing for mobile screens? Learn the dos and don’ts of Mobile UX. Sign up link : http://bit.ly/2djYrel [ Who should join ] 。People who want to learn the fundamentals of designing for mobile。Designers who want to move towards the digital space。Aspiring entrepreneurs who want to improve on existing products [ What you will learn ] 。Fundamentals of Mobile UX Design。Dos and Donts of Mobile UX [ Workshop details ] 。Date: 23 Nov。Time: 3pm - 5pm。Venue: 43B Tanjong Pagar Road (level 3)。Price: SGD 15 *Admittance to the workshop is strictly for people who paid for the event only.** Please bring your own MacBook, with Sketch or Illustrator installed [ Instructor ] Doralin KellyUX/UI Design Ninja Design Ninja and Star Wars fan girl. I run my own design practice between SG & NYC. I work with awesome startups and global brands on everything from branding to UX/UI design for websites and mobile apps. ______Policy:1. ALPHA Camp reserves the right to cancel or postpone the event due to unforeseen circumstances. In the event that the workshop is cancelled or postponed, all paid participants will be informed via email and full-refund will be given.
events.location: Alpha Camp, 43B Tanjong Pagar Road, Singapore

events.name: SG Android DevFest.Asia @ Google
events.description: As part of DevFest Asia, come join us at Google's new Singapore HQ. Full name and Email submission is required to attend, please submit your particulars here: https://goo.gl/forms/rSz6SNy7zVyTy7LN2 Google welcomes Android Developers to check out their community space as well as share their insights on Tango. Tango (formerly named Project Tango in-testing) is a technology platform developed and authored by Google that uses computer vision to enable mobile devices, such as smartphones and tablets, to detect their position relative to the world around them without using GPS or other external signals. Agenda for the Night Session 1 - Tango Speakers - Adrian Tout & Wim Meeussen (from Google)  Session 2 - Achieving Developer Happiness by automating your Android tests and workflows Speaker bio: Khang Toh is currently the CTO at PicoCandy and the organizer of Android In Asia. He has been working on mobile technologies since 2008 and has led engineering teams at multiple startups in the US and now SIngapore. Food & Drinks - Sponsored by Google
events.location: Google Singapore, Mapletree Business City II, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-01

events.name: Hacking UX: Product Thinking for Techies
events.description:
So you've got a techy business idea? How do you know exactly what the product you should be building is? 

Designing product can seem daunting, but it doesn't have to be so. From understanding the basics of business models and user behaviours, this workshop with the amazing Melissa Ng will teach you the basics of how to design a stellar product your users will love.

Be a part of DevFest.Asia and Southeast Asia's biggest community-run developer festival with this amazing workshop, running for the second year at an amazing new venue! :)

events.name: Null SG Meetup - November
events.description: Please change pass (photo identification) at level 1. Room details: ORQ Knowledge@Central Training room. ------------------------------------------------------- Agenda: • Introduction • Introducing Null Rookie • "What can we learn from other disciplines? - Geo-Spatial Theory & Psychology 101" by Emil Tan • "A Tale of a Vulnerability Disclosure in Singapore" by Lennon ------------------------------------------------------- What can we learn from other disciplines? - Geo-Spatial Theory & Psychology 101 Abstract: This short presentation aims to introduce studies done by geo-spatial geographers and psychologists, and discuss what we can learn from them to improve the cyberspace. A tale of a vulnerability disclosure in Singapore Abstract: This talk will talk about vulnerability disclosure on a local firm and some lessons and experience to take away when doing a responsible or coordinated disclosure with a company that has no bounty program or security team to manage a disclosure. Bio: Lennon is currently working in EY as a security consultant focusing on pen testing. He is passionate about security and helping to improve security as a whole. He spend his free time procrastinating and reading up on security related issues and topic.
events.location: 1 Raffles Quay, EY (Ernst & Young), North Tower, Level 14, 1 Raffles Quay (048683), Singapore, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: iOS Dev Scout November Meetup
events.description: Venue: #09-01, PayPal Office at Suntec Tower 5 Speakers: • Yeo Kheng Meng - IoT engineer at Singapore Power • Kenneth Poon - Technical Lead (iOS) at PropertyGuru Agenda: • 6:30pm: Come have some pizza (Sponsored by PayPal), say hello to other iOS devs  • 7:15pm: A Science Project: Swift Serial Chat - by Kheng Meng • 7:45pm: iOS dylib Injection - by Kenneth • 8:15pm: Show & Tell (if any) About the Topics: • Chat apps are dime a dozen and they usually operate over Wifi, 3G, Bluetooth or Ethernet. How about a chat app that uses none of those? Mix the modern Swift programming language with the decades-old serial port technology. • Ever wondered how engineers create mods from production iOS Apps? Let's try making our own PokemonGo mod (walk anywhere) using Dylib Injection. About iOS Conf SG 2016: iOS Conf SG is an annual iOS conference organised by us. This year's conference was on the 20th and 21st of October @ Nanyang Polytechnic and it has concluded with an amazing turn out, raving responses and feedback from both the speakers and attendees. For more information, visit our iOS Dev Scout Group and iOS Conf SG Page: iOS Conf SG Website: http://iosconf.sg iOS Conf SG 2016 Videos: https://engineers.sg/conference/iosconfsg2016 iOS Conf SG Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/iosconfsg/ iOS Dev Scout Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/iosdevscout/
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: 7 habits of successful DevOps
events.description:
Hello guys! This is going to be the last meetup of 2016, so do join us as it'll be a light hearted session with food and drinks. Agenda0. Administrative updates - Dropping the "ALM" name from the user group? Why?! 1. Visual Studio and Team Service roadmap - What's new and what's to come. 2. 7 habits of successful DevOps - Microsoft's Developer Division, responsible for building massive software projects such as Visual Studio, Visual Studio Team Services, and Team Foundation Server, has been on a multi-year journey to transform itself from a waterfallian box product into an agile online service and regular client updates. In this session, we review the process and practices used by this division to deliver faster, react to feedback, plan and learn, stay connected to customers, continually improve quality, and measure success. We discuss the organizational issues experienced during the transformation and give examples of key practices and metrics used to improve the organization sprint over sprint. Hear about the 7 habits Microsoft as an organization learned in moving from a traditional software delivery team to a modern DevOps team. Speaker Louis Leong Louis is a Technical Evangelist at Microsoft Singapore working with teams to adopt DevOps, agile and development best practices. He is a certified Scrum Master and has an extensive background in software development, architecture and building enterprise scale applications. 


 Refreshments provided at 6.45, session starts at 7pm
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: IxD Session: A conversation with Lee Jun Lin, Minitheory
events.description:
The 7th instalment of the Design Leader series of meetup, we will be speaking with Jun Lin from Minitheory. Minitheory needs no introduction, a product design studio based in Singapore, they have crafted the experience of many apps and websites we use today.  In this session, we'll be speaking with Jun Lin (Jun), who is the co-founder and currently leading Minitheory to new heights.  About Jun Lin Not content with just pushing pixels, Jun Lin co-founded Minitheory, a digital product studio helping businesses and organisations through user experience, interaction and visual design. He believes the best user interface gets out of the user’s way, and the best designers balance business and user needs.  Jun was previously Lead Product Designer at HomeAway Asia (formerly travelmob). 

Agenda for the night  7pm – 7.30pm: Registration, drinks, snacks and networking 7.30pm – 8.30pm: Conversation with Jun Lin  8.30pm – 9pm: Networking and drinks :) We're hoping to keep the session really informal and casual where it is more conversational centric so bring along some of your burning questions to the session. The value of the meetup is as good as the questions asked :) Also, if you would like to ask the question privately, please email me at kiat@ixda.sg and I'll ask them on your behalf :) Alternatively, you may like to tweet us the questions to @IxDASG and we can have that answered! A BIG thanks to our partner AlphaCamp Singapore for helping us to get the venue and The Co for sponsoring the venue. Thanks to Minitheory for sponsoring the snacks.

events.name: Discussion and Open space for Emerging Big data and Analytics Technologies
events.description: Agenda : 7:00 PM : Networking and Discussion 7:30 PM : Discussion on Emerging OLTP Databases on top of Hadoop and its future 8:00 PM : Breakout session 9:00 PM : END and BYE BYE

events.name: WordPress Meetup (November 2016)
events.description:
An Introduction to the WordPress REST API Jack Lenox, WordPress.com VIP Team, Automattic Community Open Space: Please comment (below) on topics you would like to discuss, experts & enthusiasts present will answer questions. This will be casual. Possible topics could be - • What makes a good theme??  • My site loads slow, how do I make it faster?  • And more (just comment)  Are you interested in sharing something about WordPress as well? Let us know!  


Do join us from 7pm for a 7:30pm start. We're always looking for speakers and volunteers to help with our meetups! Please contact us if you're interested in helping out. Please call Jon at[masked] if you have an issue getting to the meetup. Do not abuse the number please :) One more thing: we're holding this meetup in conjunction with DevFest.Asia, happening between 18 to 27 November. Check out some of the other great developer-focused events happening around Singapore!
events.location: General Assembly Office, 8 Claymore Hill #03-01, Singapore
